website_summaries.verdict: A pack that can handle the needs of a long-distance runner including keeping water on hand.
pros: Allows you to have water handy
Has 4 extra pockets for personal items such as a cell phone or snacks
Does not bounce around while running
Company stands behind the promise that the bladder will not leak
cons: While this pack does have reflective strips on the front, it doesn't have any on the back

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running Super convenient bag
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for running Super convenient bag. It's lightweight and easy to slip on and off. The 2 straps with a snap buckle and loops on each shoulder are important to me as they secure the bag to my body while I am running. The bag has several compartments and the 2 pockets on the side are super useful to get stuff without taking the bag out of my back. The 2 liter bag is convenient and does not move around. I am now using it every time I go for a run. I strongly recommend it for all runners.
customer_reviews.author: Ciganka

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife because we have started hiking for recreation. When she got this item she was very happy with how many little pockets it came with. My wife carries a lot of stuff with her. Regular glasses, sun glasses, tissues, keys, chapstick, etc. ...and she doesn't have to carry a water bottle! This backpack leaves her hands free for the two hiking sticks we use! Sturdy and well made. I will purchase one for myself when my present one wears out!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good experience with this!
customer_reviews.text: The only negative thing I can say is the hose, although insulated didn't really do much in the way of keeping the water cool. Other than that, I loved it. I bought this for a motorcycle trip because I don't like to stop every 30mi for water and a cup holder just doesn't cut it. I put a large cylindrical ice cube in, and filled with water. Stayed cool all day!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love this hydration backpack. It is super lightweight and comfortable to wear for long periods. I bought an insulation bag for my water bladder to keep my water cold. I was hoping the insulation on the straw would help with the "leftover" water that stays in the straw after taking a drink. Sadly, it doesn't. The water in the bladder is cold, but the insulation on the straw did nothing to help keep it that way. So before getting to the cold water, I had to drink the hot one first. That's my only gripe about the backpack, that the straw didn't do anything to keep the water cold. Otherwise, it's a great price and even better backpack!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my Hike!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Customer service is great! I received today a replacement from the company and it's working great! I think the one I received had a bladder issue. ------ I’m very disappointed with this purchase! First day yesterday 7 miles run it was leaking water from the bite valve and good luck keeping the cap closed! Today it totally ruined my 10 miles hike! The hydration pack started leaking for no reason and covered my back with water! It’s been only 2 days since I got this. Will definitely return it!
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: It's okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this backpack mainly for horseback riding and it's been great. I can fit my phone, snack, hoof pick and probably some other small items in it and stay hydrated. The mouth piece on the bladder is really weird; it has somewhat of a gap under it that makes it feel like the mouth piece is going to fall off. I imagine I'll probably get a different bladder, but the overall cost was so cheap that it didn't seem worth it to send it back. The backpack itself is actually pretty nice compared to ones in stores that are similarly priced. The straps are a little wide and dig into the front of my armpits just a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag, Plastic Clip to Hold Hose Broke Off within 2 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, but I gently put the hose under the clip and the plastic clip broke straight away! They need to make the clip metal, not plastic. Drinking through the hose is super handy. I like that there are multiple pockets. Never bounced during the entire run, it fits/tightens very sturdily around your body. I had to push some of the excess straps under the main shoulder straps as they were too long, I may have to cut them. I can now run for longer distances and have plenty to drink/eat along the way thanks to this bag. Other than the plastic clip breaking, pretty good so far, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Darko

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Mess after claiming it would not.
customer_reviews.text: Leaked all over on the way to the hike. Claims to be leakproof but is very flawed. The seal where you put water in is designed poorly and leaks as you move the bag around. End result is half your water is gone before you start. Buy another pack. Update: They sent a second pack that does not seem to have the same problem. The gasket seal / threading could be better designed. Be sure to test it out well for leaks before leaving your water location.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gruss

customer_reviews.title: A little larger then expected
customer_reviews.text: I really love it. However, its a little larger than expected. I didn't want that many compartments. Just wanted enough room for keys and phone in addition to bladder. More room equals more material, length and weight. The extra pockets were not needed for a 2 hour hike. Overall, very good product. Well made. AND adjustable straps.
customer_reviews.author: Circelligoddess

customer_reviews.title: No thermal pouch
customer_reviews.text: This would definitely have been a five star item. However, I was missing my insulated thermal pouch which I really need in order to keep my water at a perfect temperature while I'm out riding with my baby on the back of my bike. Knowing I didn't have the thermal pouch made me very disappointed and unsatisfied. I was so ready to recommend it to my husband and so many other friends and family since we all work out but I didn't the embarrassment if them not receiving the thermal pouch and with that being unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 1 trip and then leaked horrible
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this for mountain biking and got 1 good use. Today went to fill it up to go riding and water is pouring out of the connection. Tried disconnecting, make sure it’s tight etc but can’t stop the flowing water. Returning for a replacement and hoping it will work for more than 1 bike trip.
customer_reviews.author: NvPAMommy

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Just ok. This either leaks or produces extreme condensation. My car was soaked after transporting this bag to our hike. I wore it anyway because I couldn’t find a leak and then my back was soaking wet all day. Still couldn’t find a leak so I think my cold water was creating MAJOR condensation perhaps? It did keep the water cold all day. A bit of an unpleasant rubbery/plastic taste to the water either from tubing or bag itself? Pretty small compartments, too. Couldn’t carry much along with us on hike in it besides the water. Wish it came with a drying rack for after cleaning. Probably should’ve just sprung for a more expensive bag:/
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great but bladder ruptured.
customer_reviews.text: This item is perfect for running. The hydration bladder however ruptured at the hose attachment part after two uses. This site doesn't have any 1.5L replacements for this brand tho.
customer_reviews.author: LY

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but falls apart
customer_reviews.text: Amazing backpack...for 6 months. All of a sudden the water-resistant coating shredded, 2 zipper seams are going, and the divider between the bottom and main pocket tore. I bought another for a friend and they had two zippers blow out as well. Such a shame - I love the design of this bag and would happily buy it again if the materials were better quality.
customer_reviews.author: M N

customer_reviews.title: Using for bicycling
customer_reviews.text: Removed the water bladder Need this size backpack to hold minimal bike tools, cell phone, inflator, snacks and gel packs I buy Hydration Backpacks because of the size, material strength (because its designed to hold the heavy bladder its thicker material) and front click straps to prevent dropping it off my shoulders during my ride
customer_reviews.author: Donald P. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: We took this with us when we did a few leisurely hikes near Grandfather Mt in western North Carolina. It never leaked and super easy to fill and clean. The water stayed cold with ice and my husband commented that the coolness against his back was never uncomfortable and even welcome at times. I liked how we could fill the collapsible bowl for our dog without everything getting wet. Worked out great. Look forward to when we can use it again.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hiking/Day Bag
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a great day bag for hiking or walks through the city. The bag looks sharp,is lightweight yet very durable, and I absolutely love all of the pockets with this design. The hydration pack was easy to setup and works well. The mesh material on the shoulder straps is also comfortable on my shoulder and back. If you're looking for a great day or hiking bag I highly suggest this setup. It was a great price for the quality and has so far exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Murray Frost

customer_reviews.title: Good, but leaks
customer_reviews.text: Pack is fine, it holds up well and has plenty of pockets to keep everything organized. It also is short and wide instead of long and skinny like other packs, great for short torso people. The hydration bag works fine but leaks out of the connection between the bladder and the hose. Not bad, but it probably loses 6 ounces over a day. enough to get you a little we. I tried adjusting the hose but no luck yet
customer_reviews.author: Seaagg05

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I dont leave many reviews, but I felt this product was worth it. I recently moved and the area I moved to had a lot of hiking trails and wildlife parks. I quickly got tired of carrying my phone, wallet, water bottle, and snacks. So I did a quick search and came across this. Was a little hesitant at first and thought about just getting a normal pack, but then folded and bought this. Haven't regretted it once. Easy to use, easy to clean, water stays cold, and has just enough space for my stuff. Most of all it stays secure to my body. I dont have to worry about it bouncing around and making my back sore.
customer_reviews.author: Jared B.

customer_reviews.title: Works well on long runs
customer_reviews.text: Have had this backpack for a few months now and really enjoying it. It is a good size, good fit and works well. I take it on long runs. I give it a 4 only because I wish the insulated bag was waterproof. As most of these types of backpacks do not even include an insulated bag this is just a small recommendation for future backpacks. I also really like the look of these backpacks. Thanks for producing a quality product that is also pretty affordable. : )
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Long Runs
customer_reviews.text: I was sick of wearing a belt with a couple 10 oz bottles for long runs. I didn't like the way it felt and it was difficult to get the bottles in and out. Have been doing weekly 10-12 mile runs and the backpack has been great. I have used it three times with no difficulties and haven't run out of water. I am able to keep a couple gels in the small pockets that i can access without taking the pack off. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Edit: Greatttt bag!!
customer_reviews.text: The bag seems to be of good material, light weight, roomy, and a great fit. However, I’m giving this 3 stars because water is constantly leaking out the lid used to close the bladder. My items in my bag and shirt were soaked due to this constant leak Edit 7/14/20: Updated review to 5 stars!! Excellent customer service and product! The company reached out to me via amazon, sent me a replacement product free of charge, AND sent me a personalized thank you card! That’s amazing and almost us heard of. The replacement has worked amazingly with no issues and I am recommending to all my cycling friends!!
customer_reviews.author: Hector Santiago

customer_reviews.title: You can not take out the nozzle (Update)
customer_reviews.text: The nozzle top part of the nozzle broke off after 3 days of use. The water bladder is now unusable since I can't get the bottom part of the nozzle out of the tube. I am very frustrated with this product. Update: Innerfit contacted me and sent me a new backpack. This company is amazing! Thank you for making it right. :-)
customer_reviews.author: A. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Great pack with small exception.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made pack, but it's a little hard to pull on and the clip for the mouth piece is a little weak. I don't have reference for how hard it is to pull, but the clip is a little easy to pull off and lose. Be careful and for the price it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: SamsStuff

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Good quality without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the product about a month ago and it was great and super helpful. Since then however, the water bladder clip has broken off and without it the hose just swings and is incredibly annoying while I run. Also, the bottom holding compartment zipper broke. The product seems good quality for the price, but I'm very disappointed in the malfunctioning parts. I really needed a backpack for running. UPDATE: The company sent me a replacement and an apology letter. The replacement works like I hoped it would and I use it a few times a week. I highly recommend this product if you're looking for a good quality training backpack but dont want to break the bank for it
customer_reviews.author: Zackary Blake

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! It's better than those other packs.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of the innerfit hydration pack. I take it hiking, kyaaking, and pretty much anywhere I know I will be outdoors for an extended period of time. The insulated bag keeps the water cold for hours and hours. It's a wonderful, stylish way to stay hydrated while keeping your hands free. The pack even has additional pockets for keeping I.D., snacks, a d other items needed for an all day adventure. It's really well made, the stitching is flawless! This is far more cost effective than those other packs.
customer_reviews.author: Max D. Golden

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used my new hydration pack yet but what I've seen upon opening and unpacking seems really great. I've tried two other packs and this one seems by far the best. The build quality is great- high quality materials like zippers and fabric. Thoughtful design touches- large opening for water, insulated water hose. I look forward to actually using the product
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Strap durability isn’t good.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved my backpack and wanted to give 5 stars, but my strap broke and I didn’t have it a good month!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Nice water pack
customer_reviews.text: A bit above average quality, seems well made. Filler cap for water a bit hard to handle and close properly.
customer_reviews.author: ABM

customer_reviews.title: Pack works great, needs set up instructions
customer_reviews.text: The backpack works well, has space for all of my items, and I love the insulated water line. I used the pack for skiing and it held everything I needed. To improve it, I would recommend sending instructions or a diagram with the pack for set up. When I first opened the pack I did not realize the slit in the mouthpiece was not punctured all the way through. As a result, I could not get water to come through the line. It would be extremely helpful to send instructions so it can be set up quickly the right way and recommend some tips for washing.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lauer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is REALLY tiny
customer_reviews.text: This is crazy small. Cute, but I'm sending it back. I can't get a wallet into most of the pockets , never mind a modern cell phone, or a spare 29inch mtb inner tube. Looks well made otherwise. I was tempted to keep it for my grandson (he is 8). You get what you pay for. No substitute for an Osprey, or a Camelbak.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Good size for 2 plus hour rides.
customer_reviews.text: Pack is comfortable for all day rides, did 4.5 hours climbing a mountain trail with the pack. Held energy snacks and cubes easily. Carried a shock pump plus tools. Made a long hard climbs and descents easy, was not bulky are move around even on the steepest descents. Would buy again. Herb
customer_reviews.author: audi30019

customer_reviews.title: Hydration, Hydration, Hydration
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product. I just went to Flagstaff Arizona and the heat was brutal there. Without my backpack full of ice cold water, I would not have made through the day. It is extremely important to stay hydrated and because of the high temperature, I continued to drink water. The backpack is very light even while full with water. I recommend this product to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile & Durable
customer_reviews.text: Great Hydration Pack. Has plenty of room to store stuff in and contours to your body well. Also, it’s surprisingly light... I sometimes forget I’m even wearing it unless it’s filled to the brim with water and other snacks. Plus it comes with an insulation that works at keeping your water cold!!! Highly Recommend This Product
customer_reviews.author: joseph earlwin slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Tastes of Chemicals
customer_reviews.text: The bag is well made and useful, but the filtered water I put in comes out tasting of chemicals. For something whose primary purpose is to deliver me water, it’s a bit disappointing. I will update my review if the taste fades over time.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Really durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as gift for a boy I work with who spends a lot of time outdoors. He's eleven and on the smaller side, so I was worried about it being loose but the adjustable straps made it so that it fit him pretty snug. The material of the pack feels and looks high quality. Everything is insulated, so no worries about leakage or tears. So far he's taken it hiking and biking and has had no complaints. It's very durable but still lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: Knguyen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect inexpensive pack!
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect. I’ve taken this pack on so many runs, and there’s a good amount of pockets to store your phone, keys, gels and other gear. Had two sets of adjustable straps to make sure the pack can be as secure or as loose as you would like. You can hear the water bouncing around as you run (but that’s just the same as other more expensive packs) and I haven’t had it leak on me once. Great customer service too!
customer_reviews.author: Grace Kochersperger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for running
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a month ago and have used it several times for my long runs in the midwest heat and absolutely love it! The best part was today they wrote me a personalized HAND-WRITTEN thank you, that is something you hardly see anymore. I will continue to support this company any way I can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grea tHydration Pack
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable pack I have ever worn! I have degenerative discs and have not been able to carry a pack on my back for years. But because of the design of this pack, I can wear it for hours with no pain. It is just the right size for a half day hike. And the water bag is perfect too. I like that there is a cap for the mouth piece to keep it clean. There is enough room for my essentials and a snack. Very well made. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alane G Kester

customer_reviews.title: Really really pleased with this purchase - I bought this as I ...
customer_reviews.text: Really really pleased with this purchase - I bought this as I wanted a hydration pack for my long runs. I'd happily use it also for hiking, long distance jogs, etc too. The backpack has some nice adjustable straps so there's no bounce at all, and I've barely noticed having it on. Overall, ticks all the boxes for me - lightweight, very comfortable, practical, and a ton of storage compartments. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M D Monro

customer_reviews.title: Ripped lining 1st day, 2nd use the bladder leaked and lost all my water.
customer_reviews.text: The first day I used this, the lining in the pack ripped, not a big deal to me because overall I liked the pack and all the zipper pouches. 2nd time using it the blader started leaking. Overall it's a great design but extremely poor quality. Would not recommend anyone purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to reach for back pockets of a cycling jersey
customer_reviews.text: Many years ago camelbak came out with a cycling specific hydration pack called the Rocket. Wore it out until it became dead. This pack is a great replacement. It has more holding capacity and like the Rocket and (drum roll)... you can get to your rear jersey pockets! Most of the packs out there are just too long. This one is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: My2cents

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bag!! The complimentary letters made me feel like I was a part of the Innerfit Family!!
customer_reviews.text: Loving my new jogging bag by InnerFit gear ...Has tons of space and storage compartments. The water bag w/dispenser tubing equip me for a good run!!...Now I gotta actually start running🤦🏽‍♂️😂
customer_reviews.author: Weldon B

customer_reviews.title: Works for wearing while trotting.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack for doing horseback endurance rides. Many packs for bicyclists are not comfortable for riding. This pack worked well. The waist band takes some pressure of shoulders and prevents bouncing. My back was happy after several hours with lots of trotting.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Tell me something good, tell me that you like it
customer_reviews.text: The pack is very light and supportive. Straps give me comfort of the pack not bouncing around on runs. I love the clips for the hose so that isn't flapping around when I run. Its my daily use backpack for running. Also helped save my life when I got lost backpacking, has a good supply of water for the size
customer_reviews.author: Kamryn Robles

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: The hydration backpack is everything it describes. The fit is adjustable and several storage pockets without the bulk. Bladder is very durable and great size. The bladder cooler bag is such a bonus! Great way to extend cold water for trails. I'll follow up this summer on experience with trail/OCR races in midst of TX weather. Stay tuned!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This came in and it was exactly as described and what was expected. Quality has been good - now that I've had it for a while, the additional features I didn't know I needed (like shut off valve) were already included. Great buy and I'd highly recommend this for anyone needing a hydration pack. It's not to large, but still very functional. 5 stars for sure - I even received a personalized post card from the business owner - great touch by the way!
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Pack for Short People
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great pack. Bladder is great and it fits well to my 5’2” frame. Only drawback is the waist pockets are not big enough to hold smart phones. Would hold a flip phone, but not big enough for a small smartphone. I have to wear something with pockets to hold my phone, so that is why 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Thing

customer_reviews.title: Importantempty,and completely dry the bladder. If don't clean it then bacteria,stains,and more
customer_reviews.text: I 100% love this hydration pack. I'm only 5'4 my family is much taller. But for me and shorter people this would be a perfect hydration pack. I use it on trails ,hiking,or at the NY botanical garden. I got it with my birthday gift card from my boyfriend. I have used it a few times . It has loads of storage space. Only down side about it is it is hard to open any pockets and no front pocket big enough for my cellphone . It has 2 nice side netting pockets. So if you need your cellphone on hand to grab quickly keep it in a safe pants pocket or sweater pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Love this product and the company behind its product!
customer_reviews.text: Quality product at a great price. Got a hand written note after purchase thanking me for my business. Didn’t know they were a small business but grateful that I was able to support such a great company and also get a great product! I hike with two kids so always need extra storage. Love this hydration pack!
customer_reviews.author: Milissa

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and barely noticable
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it, I wasn't a fan. It was my first backpack (or vest for that matter) and I tightened a lot of the straps too much. Once I loosened the belly strap into a more comfortable setting, it was a fantastic change in the comfort and feel. I don't normally drink much water when I run, but I wear it every time, no matter the distance. It has plenty of storage for keys, wallet, phone, and snacks as well (and obviously water). 10/10 would suggest, especially for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa Durr

customer_reviews.title: Stay hydrated!
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for our son who is an avid cyclist. He absolutely loves it and the fact that he’s got ice water through his ride. Great gift great idea. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie54

customer_reviews.title: This one is by far the best! High quality material
customer_reviews.text: As a long distance runner, I have tried a variety of hydration backpack. This one is by far the best! High quality material, super lightweight and perfectly fit to your body type. I especially love that it does not move around while you jog. You forget you are carrying it until...you need to re-hydrate!
customer_reviews.author: audrey

customer_reviews.title: This back pack is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This back pack is amazing I am a weekend hiker and this is a perfect size for a 3 hour hike. I pack it up and I like that it has a lot of little pockets for snacks, chap stick, sunscreen, keys, money, cooling towel's Love it. It doesn't leak at all. I also love the straps very comfortable .
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a small hydration bag with pockets for my 4-6 miles walk. This item is perfect, one can carry 2 liters of water, has several pockets for lots of storage. I love the belts that go around the waist perfect for emergency snacks. I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: perfect for what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: Works great just as advertised. Good price. I especially like the snap-in hoses and nozzles. Since my son is small for a 10 year old, he feels like the straps dig some on his neck/shoulders. Overall we like it!
customer_reviews.author: pjindy

customer_reviews.title: The product delivered in all promises without any compromises.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! I needed a camel pack to run a few Spartan races and it far exceeded expectations. The storage alone was well worth prichep, durability, construction and insulated pack was a huge plus. It kept my water ice cold while.maintaing frozen hydration pops as well. The lightweight construction was essential as the miles, elevation and obstacles increased. The cherry on top was a personalized thank you card sent in the mail with actual handwriting! Phenomenal product, company and customer service...I am a cheerleader and fan Inner Fit!!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Immediately leaking where the hose plugs into the water bladder; soaked the whole unit during my fist run with it this morning. It was leaking from the get go (i.e., when I filled). The size/weight is great although the bladder is somewhat small (not sure if it's even a liter). Still, if I didn't lose some of my water there would have been enough for about 13 (slow) miles in the heat. I'm disappointed and will have to pick up a different brand it seems, returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I recieved a pack that was a return. The inside of bladder still had water in it, and a strap was broke off. Returning
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Drink valve didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. Valve to drink from didn't work. Could not get water to flow
customer_reviews.author: Dodie Tall

customer_reviews.title: Running with comfort
customer_reviews.text: I picked up trail running recently and knew I would need a reliable hydration backpack for the desert climate. This pack was a great deal. The adjustable straps allowed me to make the changes I needed for the pack to fit me perfectly. The backpack stays in place and doesn't jostle around while I'm on the move. The numerous zip pockets are fantastic for snacks, keys, wallet, etc. I really like that it has a feature to run wired headphones through. Innerfit's customer service was prompt and helpful when I had an inquiry about the pack was well.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: AAA+++
customer_reviews.text: We love this camel pack. It’s has tons of adjustments to fit just about any one. I got this for my ten yr old and his mom got Jealous. So we r going to surprise her with one soon. Thx you for making good Quality gear that we can trust to perform anywhere’s we go. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Curt lanyi

customer_reviews.title: comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: Great for running, I'm a big guy, but this is adjustable. This is also my first bag with hydration bladder, which works great.
customer_reviews.author: L&A

customer_reviews.title: Company Review
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pack for EDC Las Vegas 2019. It stored all my necessities and more. It was lightweight and comfortable throughout the 3-days I was in Las Vegas. They wrote me a handwritten post card thanking me for my purchase, and I could not be more happier. The majority of companies do not do that, and if they do, they send a generic post card. I really did appreciate the post card they sent, and I gladly left a review of their product. Their product is genuinely good, and I still use it without any issues. A solid buy for my part.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the clip that holds the hose
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on Sep 20, 2018. Nov 24, 2018 Holds everything I need it to hold, holds plenty of water. The backpack seems to be holding up just fine, all the zippers work still. But today the clip broke off that holds the hose. Not sure if I can order a new clip. If I can't, I'll come up with an alternative. seems that the clip is about the weakest point of the whole thing. Probably need a couple of those things.
customer_reviews.author: Chris McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Bottom valve leaks
customer_reviews.text: When I took it out of the package I was excited to use it, so I filled it with tap water to check the seals on the water pack, and the bottom valve had a pretty bad leak. No matter which was I oriented the bag, it was still leaking. I’m just a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Afro

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great buy comes in handy with carrying your wallet your keys and everything else while biking.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Good size and lots of pockets
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and the thermal pouch is a plus. Comfortable strap, can be also used as a registered backpack
customer_reviews.author: Cormack

customer_reviews.title: Inner Fit makes the best hydration pack.
customer_reviews.text: Inner Fit makes a great bag for almost anything. Great for running , hiking are for long walks. Holds just enough water for a 5k or 10 k run and it is not to heavy while running. Can take out water bladder and use the bag for sight seeing or just walking around town . Perfect size and great price. If you are a person who stays on the go this bag is a must buy.
customer_reviews.author: James A Land

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fit and it’s comfortable. But my water did get hot after about an hour. But I’m still going to use it
customer_reviews.author: roxy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I used it at Burningman and it worked really well for me. The zippers are really good and wont let any dust inside your bag which is AMAZING!!!! It has plenty of space which gives you carry your necessary tools for a day. I had to contact for a support and they took care of me right away. Great value and a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Merikundo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.....
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I use it for hiking and biking. I don't do long trips so the 1.5 L is the right side for me. The wide opening makes it easy to fill or clean and the multiple pieces to the mouth piece make them also very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B Piechowicz

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, good water capacity, good price
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5' 7" at 150 lbs. and the pack fit me very well. Ran North Burma trail in Annadel State Park. The pack did well trotting up hill on the rain slick path. Surprisingly, there was very little shifting or bouncing on the downhill. 8+ miles and there was still plenty of water left over. Storage is adequate for small items such as my phone, keys, jerky and other food stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Fvallin

customer_reviews.title: Great products from a great company
customer_reviews.text: Not only is the pack & bladder great quality, but I had a small problem with my hose and the seller was super on top of it! Was not expecting such a fast and caring response to make sure the replacement worked out! The pack secures nicely and doesn't slip around, enough room in the side pockets for gels or small bars and if you're on a real long run the other pockets could hold much more. Definitely will be buying from them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Insulated Bladder
customer_reviews.text: I loved the shape of this and the fit! The black and blue color combination looks great. The pack came with an insulated cover for the bladder which was a nice touch and kept the water cool.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia B

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for mountain biking.
customer_reviews.text: The chest and waist straps hold the pack steady on rough trails. I use the assorted pockets to hold tools, tire pump, protein bar, small first aid kit, keys, wallet and cell phone. Best pack for the money that I have had.
customer_reviews.author: edjoyce

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for price
customer_reviews.text: The straps aren’t the most comfortable. Otherwise it’s not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Le

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable hydration backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great hydration pack! The fact that it has a chest strap as well as a waist strap is an absolute must for me. Being able to tighten up both straps really eliminated any possible bounce while running. The space is also an advantage: I can fill the pockets with a cell phone, keys, a wallet, gel packs, etc. Thanks to the side pockets, I didn't have to take the pack off to get to the gel packs during my first run which was a real bonus. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam K.

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Used for running and hiking. No leaks. It is lightweight. Just did a little tweak (small cut) on the mouthpiece, for water to flow better when drinking.
customer_reviews.author: NLR

customer_reviews.title: Does the job the right way
customer_reviews.text: I had no problems with the bag. it was awesome, lightweight and holds a good amount of water. My only problem was after a bit the water taste was different not sure because it started to get room temp (the water) or the material it is made from but other than that I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a Camelback.
customer_reviews.text: This product is NOT made by Camelback. There is no reason to use the word Camel in the description other than to mislead people. In addition it is heavy, ill-fitting and simply not good quality.
customer_reviews.author: UCS308

customer_reviews.title: Poor design on loose mouth piece.
customer_reviews.text: Good bag with useful pockets. Great for snowboarding in terms of mobility. Hydration bladder is fine but the mouth piece was lost on the mountain pretty quickly. Serious Design flaw in that the mouth piece is not secured in any way other than friction.
customer_reviews.author: Libtech

customer_reviews.title: Do not fill it all the way .
customer_reviews.text: I used this product mostly for hiking . it's a great lightweight backpack and with the thermal pouch compartment it keeps my water cold 98%of the time . The hose Is easy accessible. I dont think i could use it for running though. You have to hold the hose every time you do cause of the length. All in all I love this backpack .
customer_reviews.author: Ross Kimpling

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Day Hiking Hydration Backpack!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack performed even better than expected. Ordered after returning a disappointing brand/model. Fit comfortably. Kept the water cool and refreshing!
customer_reviews.author: Danette Taunton

customer_reviews.title: Super adjustable and quality
customer_reviews.text: Each component makes sense and helps me adjust the fit and/or has some quality to it that makes it prevent issues (loose fit, flailing tube, leaking mouthpiece). I am new to hydration backpacks, but it beats out the one I got from Target by far.
customer_reviews.author: David Chang

customer_reviews.title: Quality product- highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! I bought 1 of these for my two teenage kids and myself for a trip to Sedona, AZ. This kept our water cold ALL day, which is saying a lot for a day in the AZ sun in June. The mouthpiece is easy to use (you can easily get a lot of water) and the zippered pockets are great for storing your phone & small snacks. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: I love my hydration pack. I used it for a week at kids camp and it really helped me to stay hydrated day and night. The insulating pouch kept my water cool - even in the Arizona summer. All the pockets made it possible for me to carry everything I needed throughout the day without an extra pack.
customer_reviews.author: Marilee Brees

customer_reviews.title: Never hike without this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hydro packs out there. Holds enough cold water for a day hike with snack and camera room!!
customer_reviews.author: The 4 ziggys

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material. Ripped after 2 hikes
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to work great, but Iwent on two hikes and it’s ripped allllll along the seems. It has only been used to hold my water and keys. It seems like Cheap material. Update: was sent a brand new one without notification, which I appreciate and after my next few excursions I’ll let you know how it’s going. Maybe I got a bad apple of the bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great product for long Runs
customer_reviews.text: I have trained for a few marathons and completed my first last November. Unfortunately I did not have this during that time and was running, holding my water bottle. This pack relieves so much stress from forearms and shoulders for longer runs. It is very convenient and provides enough space for all my necessities when I am going to be out for a few hours. In my estimations this type of pack is the best value for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Jrazzpple

customer_reviews.title: Just because it was defective
customer_reviews.text: I only rated this product a 1 star because it arrived defective. I need to return it and get another one but I just haven't done that yet. The left strap was not anchored to the bottom of the pack. But I plan to get another one and I'm sure it will be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Stone

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for when I ride my bike and it works great. It fits well and holds just the right amount of water for me. The water stays cool and it’s super easy to drink from it. I’m pleased with my first hydration pack.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for running and hiking. THis will be used mainly for spartan races. It is lightweight and sits low, not bulky. Holds plenty of water and lots of pockets for power bars or phone.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Martz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for skiing and hiking
customer_reviews.text: I use this for skiing and hiking. I have owned many through the years. This is the most functional. I usually don't use the water bladders when skiing because they freeze up, but this will hold your canned frosty's without making you feel uncomfortable on the lift. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: TRC

customer_reviews.title: Good little pack.
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for short hike or outing. Holds essentials such as small firstaid kit, light, lightweight jacket, foodbars, etc. Room for keys, knife, extra batteries, phone. Nice buy.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking pack!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my nephew and he loves it. Actually said he was getting ready to buy one for himself. Perfect size to not be in the way on a hike, but still have a place for essentials.
customer_reviews.author: shawne mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and enough storage without too much weight
customer_reviews.text: I have been walking 5-7 miles a few times a week and this has been the perfect way to carry car keys, phone and water while walking. Fits well. Easy to keep clean. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Valentinas

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean with large opening and detachable hose and mouth piece.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Cheap clips/straps
customer_reviews.text: Waist strap clip broke in my first run with it. Sucks because it's a nice piece of equipment otherwise but who knows what else is wrong. EDIT: Awesome, customer support contacted me sent me a new one immediately. 5 runs over 6 miles some as far as 15. Minor rubbing and scratches, water tastes weird unless thorough cleaning. Overall nice pack, especially for the price. Edit: 5 uses of over 7 miles each. Comfortable
customer_reviews.author: A sad runner.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a spartan race. I put a sandwich bag full of ice in the pack and it kept it cool for 3+ hours. The double strap allowed me to move freely and the pack stay where it needed to be. Customer service is excellent. They definitely take care of the customer
customer_reviews.author: Ben Fulkerson

product_meta.title: InnerFit Insulated Hydration Backpack and Water Bladder, Durable Camel Backpack Hydration Pack - Running, Hiking, Biking and Outdoor Activities - Lightweight Water Backpack
feature_bullets: ✅ SUPERIOR RIPSTOP MATERIAL ALL AROUND WHICH can sustain harsher conditions than common materials found in other hydration backpacks. Additionally, our UPGRADED STRONGER zippers will ensure the safety of your belongings. Bring your running backpack in TOUGH ENVIRONMENTS without worrying about its integrity.

✅ ICE-COLD WATER is delivered to you in the middle of your afternoon hike thanks to the insulated pouch which keeps your water fresh for hours! NO CONDENSATION which wets your back anymore. As an added bonus, the pouch SECURES your hydration bladder in place even more so that it doesn't bounce inside the camel backpack.

✅ WHILE OTHER HYDRATION BACKPACKS COME WITH a water bladder that leaks after a few uses, the InnerFit water pack backpack contains a LEAK-PROOF, TASTE-FREE and BPA-FREE bladder of the HIGHEST QUALITY. Equipped with an ON-OFF valve, the high-flow soft mouthpiece allows you to EFFORTLESSLY STAY HYDRATED during runs or long hikes. No more hassle while cleaning your gear thanks to the EASY 1-CLICK CONNECTIONS on both ends of the insulated hose

✅ FEEL COMFORTABLE THANKS TO the breathable mesh pad provided on our hydration backpack. The unique design ALLEVIATES PRESSURE on your body and the 3 sets of SOLID ADJUSTABLE STRAPS ensure both a BOUNCE-FREE experience and a SNUG FIT FOR ALL BODY TYPES, which makes this the ideal camel pack water backpack for running. Get COMFY even during your most intense activities!

✅ STAY ORGANIZED WITH 6 independent compartments. SAFELY & EFFICIENTLY store your personal items in your running hydration pack and save time and discomfort with SIDE MESH-POCKETS you can reach at a moment's notice while on the run. Our backpacks make perfect marathon runners gifts or gifts for runners in general

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
